jobDescription: Kelly Services is currently seeking a Clinical Data Analyst I in South San Francisco, CA to work an initial 12-month contract assignment for one of our top clients. Kelly is a full-service workforce solutions provider to 98% of the Fortune 100™ companies. We provide employment to more than 700,000 people annually and we deal with some of the largest and best companies both nationally and locally. Primary Description of theClinical Data Analyst IRole: The Clinical Data Analyst I will be joining the Modeling and Simulation (MS) group within the Clinical Pharmacology Department in the Department of Development Sciences. The candidate will provide technical support for the Modeling and Simulation activities to assess the clinical pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamics (PKPD) of drug candidates and marketed products, in order to ensure that the right drug is administered to the right patient at the right dose and regimen. Primary Responsibilities of the Clinical Data Analyst I:Contribution to the planning of datasets, conduct of graphical data analyses including C-QT and Exposure-Response, QC of documents and programming, regulatory submission and simple MS analyses if applicable.Acquire the basic Clinical Pharmacology and MS knowledge to perform such tasks.Support internal/external presentation and reporting of data section and other sections of MS analysis plans and results as applicable.Assist the development of standardization of MS analyses.Contribute to departmental initiatives such as literature database, real world data, system infrastructure, software/tool and other efforts.Education and Experience Requirements of theClinical Data Analyst I:M.S. or B.S. or equivalent experience in Statistics, Mathematics, Pharmacometrics, Engineering, Computer Science, other life science or related field with 0+ year for M.S. or 2+ years for B.S. of relevant experience, preferable in the Biotechnology or Pharmaceutical Industry.Hands-on expertise in R or S-Plus programming.Experience in data pooling and graphical representation of clinical trial data.Experience with MS dataset, methodologies, and software such as NONMEM as well as Phoenix WinNonlin.Strong analytical, organization, and communication skills, attention to detail, as well as working effectively in a multidisciplinary team setting are essential.Candidate must be open-minded and ready to learn new concepts and tools.Additional Information:Contract assignment, duration 12-months.Work schedule: Full-Time; First Shift.Pay Rate: Determined by experience.Kelly Temporary Employee Perks:Group medical, prescription, vision, dental, life, and short-term disability insurance options that are available for purchase—and the coverage is portableService bonus plan and Holiday pay plan, if qualifiedWeekly electronic pay optionsFree online training campus availableExclusive online employee communityCorporate discountsApply Now! This position is recruited for by a remote Kelly office, not your local Kelly branch. To be considered for this position, you must submit your resumes to kynzie.reetz@kellyscientific.com. Thank you for your interest in the assignment!Why Kelly®?
